messages.message: Hi team, I just created a new member in my org and I can't seem to find a way to create a project / conversation. Is that expected and if not, is there any work around?
That's expected if the org user has no access to any shared workspaces with developer or above role. You can still go to workspaces > my workspace to create one in your personal workspace

hmm so yeah going to workspaces > my workspace works! However, I'd expect the same option to show up for members as well though. The reason for this is, when a project is created, the default is that it's in their personal workspace and that seems to not be a limitation for members.

This is part of the requirement from the Roles project (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xPMeaq-SZnAQW4pRSJbxjqfwIr4i1qs-8A4Lbd_9lMM/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.n22mi4ib7u0t). We want to hide distracting ui from users, (i.e human reviewers). For pages orthogonal to workspaces, we hide UI based on users' highest role across shared workspaces. Things will be clearer once we disable personal workspaces for selected users.
Users should probably either:
• not have personal workspaces, and their highest roles are reviewers across shared workspaces → so they can't create project/chat at all
• have personal workspace and their highest roles are developer/above → so they can create project/chat
I do agree that the current behavior is odd :sweat_smile:
cc @jack.robbins
Sounds good! Thank you for the explanation :slightly_smiling_face:
And to confirm - you weren't an Org admin @Sayan?
yep, this view is for a nonadmin that was just created in my org

then yes seeing fewer CTAs is expected. The weirdness should be far less of an issue for customer workflows - who typically start with their org admins creating & assigning users to shared workspaces.
sounds good, thanks for explaining the customer context as well!
